data: GYN Pre Procedure / Enhanced Recovery After Surgery (ERAS) Pre Operative (Pre Anesthesia Clinic)
Refer to reference text for appropriate Pathway for corresponding surgery
Instruct patient to cleanse skin with Chlorhexidine Gluconate evening prior to surgery and morning of surgery
Instruct patient to shower evening prior to surgery
Instruct patient to cleanse skin with Chlorhexidine Gluconate wash morning of surgery
Carbohydrate Loading not applicable for diabetic patients on insulin
No solid food after midnight. Clear fluids after midnight and up to 1 hour before hospital check-in time (or 3 hours prior to slated OR time)
Instruct patient to have nothing by mouth after midnight. Drink 2 cups (500 mL or 16 ounce) of clear juice (e.g. apple juice) on evening prior to surgery
For VGH and UBCH: Preoperative medication instructions as per "VGH and UBCH Pre-operative Medication Guide"
Notify Anaesthesiologists if patients receiving anticoagulation/antiplatelet agents for discontinuation and/or heparin bridging orders
Instruct patient to take prescribed morning medications as per Anesthesia
For VGH and UBCH: Use Pre Admission Clinic Pre Operative Lab Tests (Module) for Laboratory orders

Group and Screen for Gynecology AND Gynecology Oncology:   All open abdominal procedures (excluding MIS cases and Vulvectomy) and only for procedures with a high risk of bleeding OR high risk of conversion to OPEN procedure
Pre Admission Clinic Pre Operative Lab Tests (Module)
Basic Metabolic Panel (Lytes, Urea, Creat, Gluc)
Pregnancy Test and Spec Gravity Urine
Routine, Reason: Pre-operative evaluation, Order for future visit
Consider consultation with Endocrinology if A1c is greater than 8.5%
For VGH and UBCH: Consultation with Perioperative Blood Management Program (PBMP) is required for all patients with Hemoglobin less than 115 g/L
